TextBody:
Hello Manojkumar, 

Thank you for your time in today's session .

In the meeting we have discussed the following details regarding the possibility of creating a new EPP server.

First of all, you will have to create a SNAPSHOT from the virtualisation environment to have a point of return in case the next step fail.

Once the snapshot is taken, since the current EPP server version is at 5.9.2.0 we will bring it to the 5.9.4.0 version which will allow us to create the new EPP server with the 5.9.4.0 version directly.

The next step will be to take a System Backup V2 from the existing EPP console to backup the database, policies, rights and all the configuration made, so we can import them in the new EPP VM .  The backup file and the password should be stored locally so we can use them later.

Next we need to download the EPP VM image and to create the new VM into your virtualisation environment. After the creation we will assign the desired vCPUs and RAMs and start the machine, to assign the network details. While the settings are filled in, we need to shut down the old EPP VM.
Here we will use the same IP as the old EPP VM, so that the existing clients can communicate directly with the new VM, without creating a downtime. 

As soon as the details are added and the new EPP VM is up and running, we will connect to the EPP web console to import the System backup V2, then we will refresh the entire web page and check if the rules / policies / computers / details  are present. 

The next step will be to update the EPP version to the latest one 5.9.4.1 and to upgrade the EPP clients using the latest client version. 

Finally, we will require to test the communication between the server and one client to verify if it is made correctly. 

Please check with your management team all the details and let us know when we can schedule a new session to perform the above steps .

Looking forward for your response.

Best regards,

Hello Manojkumar, 

Thank you for your time in today's session .

In the meeting we have discussed the following details regarding the possibility of creating a new EPP server.

First of all, you will have to create a SNAPSHOT from the virtualisation environment to have a point of return in case the next step fail.

Once the snapshot is taken, since the current EPP server version is at 5.9.2.0 we will bring it to the 5.9.4.0 version which will allow us to create the new EPP server with the 5.9.4.0 version directly.

The next step will be to take a System Backup V2 from the existing EPP console to backup the database, policies, rights and all the configuration made, so we can import them in the new EPP VM .  The backup file and the password should be stored locally so we can use them later.

Next we need to download the EPP VM image and to create the new VM into your virtualisation environment. After the creation we will assign the desired vCPUs and RAMs and start the machine, to assign the network details. While the settings are filled in, we need to shut down the old EPP VM.
Here we will use the same IP as the old EPP VM, so that the existing clients can communicate directly with the new VM, without creating a downtime. 

As soon as the details are added and the new EPP VM is up and running, we will connect to the EPP web console to import the System backup V2, then we will refresh the entire web page and check if the rules / policies / computers / details  are present. 

The next step will be to update the EPP version to the latest one 5.9.4.1 and to upgrade the EPP clients using the latest client version. 

Finally, we will require to test the communication between the server and one client to verify if it is made correctly. 

Please check with your management team all the details and let us know when we can schedule a new session to perform the above steps .
